author: Syed Muthahar Saqaf
text:
P. Ganesan, Assistant Commissioner of Police, Salem City, who had campaigned for Chief Minister Jayalalithaa in the R. K. Nagar by-election while in service, is once again in the news.

He opted for voluntary retirement after serving the police department for about 29 years, with the intention of contesting Assembly election on AIADMK ticket. Mr. Ganesan has already submitted his application to the party high command for contesting from two constituencies – his native Nannilam in Tiruvarur district and Salem South . He also submitted another application favouring Ms. Jayalalitha’s candidature for the Nannilam seat.

When contacted, Mr. Ganesan said he was due to retire by this year end but he applied for voluntary retirement and was relieved on Monday.

M. Peer Mohammed, another ACP who took VRS, has applied for AIADMK ticket from Chepauk-Thiruvallikeni assembly constituency in Chennai.
title: Another ACP takes VRS to contest polls
